abstract: Plan to allow deer hunting near downtown Boston is decried by activists and citizens, who argue burgeoning deer population should be reduced by non-lethal means; civic officials claim hunt is cheaper and more effective way to avoid potential ecological distress than contraception and sterilization.
lead_paragraph: State wildlife biologists say the hunt in the Blue Hills Reservation is needed to reduce a deer population far above the ideal; animal activists insist on contraception and other nonlethal methods.

headline.main: Deer Hunt to Thin Herd Near Boston Is Criticized
headline.print_headline: Deer Hunt to Thin Herd Near Boston Is Criticized

snippet: State wildlife biologists say the hunt in the Blue Hills Reservation is needed to reduce a deer population far above the ideal; animal activists insist on contraception and other nonlethal methods.
